**Instability/Constant Crashing [No fix, possible workarounds]**

**Issue:** KSP uses excessive RAM on some Macs, leading to frequent crashes.

**Possible workarounds:**

- Reduce the Texture Quality in the Graphics settings (default is 1/2)
- Install [Active Texture Management](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/59005) - Aggressive version
- Open KSP in Low Resolution (Retina displays)

> 
> 
> 
> 1. Go to the KSP folder in Finder
> 2. Right-click/Control-click on KSP.app
> 3. Click Get Info
> 4. Check the box for "Open in Low Resolution"
> 
> 
> 
> 
>

**Caps lock does not enable precision controls [FIX]** ([Bug #634](http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/634))

**Issue:** The default key for precision controls is Caps Lock, but pressing it has no effect.

**Fix:** Reassign precision controls to another key after starting the game: Click Settings > Input > Precision Controls Toggle, then press a key such as P or `.

**Switch to Staging UI assigned to non-existent key [FIX]** ([Bug #2824](http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/2824))

**Issue:** This function is assigned to the Insert key, which does not exist on Mac keyboards.

**Fix:** After creating a backup, open the KSP\_osx/settings.cfg with TextEdit and find this section:

    UIMODE_STAGING{    primary = [COLOR=#008000][B]Insert[/B][/COLOR]    secondary = None    group = 0    switchState = Any}

Change **Insert** to any key that's not used for something else, such as **O** or **Equals**. Save and restart KSP.

A full list of key codes for Unity can be found [here](http://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/KeyCode.html). (Thanks to [SMILIE for the link](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/46365-0-23-5-Hullcam-VDS-Converted-DEA-to-MU-Updated-7-Jun?p=1298291&viewfull=1#post1298291))

* * *

**Launcher and Patcher Issues:**

**Key:** **No fix available****,** **Workaround****,** **User fix****,** **SQUAD fix**

**Patcher fails to update [WORKAROUND]** ([Bug #2844](http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/2844))

**Issue:** Patcher consistently fails to update. The KSP store update server is not currently working for anyone, though there have been OS X-specific issues in the past.

**Workaround:** Update KSP by downloading directly from the KSP or Steam store and installing it in a new location. Then copy your saves from the old KSP\_osx/saves folder to the new installation. Update and install mods as needed.
You are a Titan among men for addressing this. Thanks.
